title: Value of a definite integral using substitution

content.question: Let y = f(x) be the solution to the differential equation <math> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> </math> = x − y with initial condition f(2) = 8. What is the approximation for f(3) obtained by using Euler’s method with two steps of equal length, starting at x = 2 ?

topic.text: 7.5: (BC ONLY) Approximating Solutions Using Euler's Method

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
